title: UK weather: Travel chaos looms as week's worth of rain to fall in ONE DAY
text:

Brits are being warned to expect travel chaos tomorrow when a week's worth of rain is to fall in ONE DAY. Temperatures will plunge towards the middle of the week, with forecasters even predicting snow in some parts. Tomorrow will see some parts drenched as a fifth of February's average rainfall is due to fall in one day. The West, Wales and the North West through to the South West are among areas that will be worst hit. The band of wet weather, which will be moving in from the Atlantic and heading slowly eastwards, could cause up to 20mm of rain and gusts of around 50mph in the West and up to 60mph in Scotland. (Photo: Met office) 
The Met Office forecast cold easterly winds from Russia arriving from Wednesday and lasting to the end of the week. Forecaster Mark Wilson said: “After strong winds and rain on Monday, cold easterly winds from the continent are expected to make it turn colder from Wednesday. "The winds’ original source is Russia and day will feel cold and nights will be below freezing, at -4C in rural parts, with the east generally coldest and with the greatest risk of any light snow. (Photo: Getty) 
“There is potential for the cold to reach the West later in the week, with perhaps snow on high ground." As stormy weather moves in from the Atlantic and icy Russian winds sweep in from the east, the UK will become a "battleground" for the turbulent weather fronts. Fellow Met Office forecaster Craig Snell said: "From midweek onwards we will see an easterly set up begin to develop and it is going to feel quite chilly. As stormy weather moves in from the Atlantic and icy Russian winds sweep in from the east, the UK will become a "battleground" for the turbulent weather fronts. (Photo: Getty) 
"By the end of the week we are in a battleground between the Altantic and high pressure to the east, and it looks like the east will win out." Bookmakers Coral are taking bets on this February being the wettest on record. The odds on this month being the wettest stand at 1-2, with this month being the most blustery at 2-1. Coral's John Hill said: "The betting suggests this February is likely to be the wettest on record as it is now odds on to see more rainfall than any before in the UK. "We've also taken bets on wind speeds to reach as high as 100mph this month." Like us on Facebook
